title: The Fringe Dwellers (1986 - Australia) [Bruce Beresford] drama
description:
The Fringe Dwellers (1986 - Australia)

Drama

director . . . . Bruce Beresford
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0091081/


Australian Film Institute - WON - Best Adapted Screenplay

Filmed at Cherbourg and Murgon, Queensland, Australia

The first Australian film to cast Indigenous actors in all its leading roles, this is also a rare Australian film to be selected for the main competition at the Cannes Film Festival. Kristina Nehm stars as an Aborigine woman named Trilby, who along with her tribespeople lives on the fringes of "accepted" Australian society. Trilby's mother urges her family to remove themselves from squalor and move up to a fashionable all-white suburb. What with the snobbery of her new neighbors and an onslaught of visiting relatives, Trilby never has a moment of happiness.


Video: XviD, 704x368, 25.000 fps, 1826 Kbps, 01h34m05s
Audio: Dolby AC3, 48000 Hz, stereo, 192 kbps

DVDRip, English audio, no subtitles
